Upon returning to Rajur, he learned from his elder son, Hariom, that Anand was riding pillion on a motorcycle driven by Sagar Chavan, when they were hit by another motorcycle ridden by Hitesh Sudhakar Kale. Anand fell off the motorcycle and was run over by an Isuzu truck which fled the scene.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Ravi Subhash Raut, a salon owner, reports the death of his brother, Sachin Raut. Sachin was riding his motorcycle from Jamkhed to Rajur on 13/04/2024. Around 01:30, Sachin called Ravi, informing him that he had fallen into a ditch and was seriously injured near Mamata Board's house on the Rajur-Jalna road. Ravi and his friend Ganesh Lonkar rushed to the scene and found Sachin in the ditch. They took him to Rajur hospital, where he was declared dead. The ditch was dug by Ajaydeep Infracon Pvt. Ltd. for erecting a pole, but there were no warning signs or safety measures. Ravi alleges negligence on the part of the company and requests legal action.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Chandrabhagabai Yogesh Kadvane, aged 26, a homemaker and farmer from Tapovan, Bhokarthan, Jalna, filed a complaint at Rajur Police Station. On 12/03/2024, around 12:00 PM, her deceased husband, Yogesh Santosh Kadvane, was traveling from Tapovan to Rajur with Karbhari Ramkisan Jagdale on a Shine motorcycle (MH 21.CB 7625).  Near Madhuban Hotel on the Jalna road, Jagdale, driving recklessly and negligently, suddenly braked upon seeing an oncoming vehicle.  This caused Yogesh to be thrown from the motorcycle, resulting in a fatal head injury. He was taken to Kalavati Hospital in Jalna but passed away on 12/03/2024 at 7:14 PM.  A post-mortem was conducted on 13/03/2024, and the last rites were performed in Tapovan.  Chandrabhagabai requests appropriate action against Karbhari Ramkisan Jagdale for causing her husband's death.

Ratan received a call informing him about an accident involving his brother and Raju on the Hasnabad-Talegaon road near Latifpur.  Upon reaching the scene, he found their motorcycle trapped under a silver Toyota Etios.  Eyewitnesses stated that the car, driven by Avinash Kachru Markad, had hit the motorcycle from behind at high speed. Both Dhiraj and Raju were severely injured and taken to Hasnabad Government Hospital, then transferred to Bhokardan Government Hospital where they were declared dead around 10:00 PM. Ratan alleges that Avinash drove recklessly and negligently, causing the accident and the deaths.

Ramchandra, a 28-year-old naturopathic doctor, was traveling on his TVS motorcycle (MH20BF6407) from Gavhali to Hasnabad when he was hit by a speeding Eicher tractor driven by Akshay Vijay Mohite. The accident occurred between Gosegaon and Kaygaon Road, near a mobile tower, around 6:00 PM on 30/10/2024. Ramchandra sustained severe injuries and was taken to Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar Government Hospital but was declared dead on arrival.  The accused fled the scene after the accident.

Near Tebhurani-Rajur road, a water tanker (MH20AT65) was parked obstructing the highway, creating a hazard.  The motorcycle collided with the tanker, resulting in Tukaram's death and serious injuries to Gajanan.  Krishna Sonavane, a witness, informed others, and Gajanan was taken to Kalavati Hospital, Jalna.  The tanker driver is held responsible for the accident.

Anand died from his injuries, and the driver Ajay Vijay Dhawale, along with other passengers including Bhura Rena Dawar, his wife Nirmabai, and their three children Ashwini, Ayush, and Monika, sustained serious injuries. They were admitted to the government hospital in Jalna. Both vehicles were damaged. The complainant requests action against the driver of the Ertiga.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Mumtaz B Siraj Khan, a 36-year-old laborer from Harmule Yasin Nagar Sawangi, Aurangabad, filed a complaint regarding the death of her husband, Siraj Khan Abdula Khan, in a road accident. On October 1, 2024, Siraj Khan left home informing his wife he was going to Jalna with Sachin Seth. He called her later that evening saying he was in Jalna but after that his phone was switched off. The next morning, the police answered his phone and then disconnected the call. Later, Mumtaz’s brother-in-law, Rais Khan, informed her about Siraj’s death in an accident.  She confirmed his identity at the Rajur Government Hospital where he was found with a head injury.  They found out that Siraj was travelling in a truck with registration number MH 18 M 4386. The truck driver, whose identity is unknown, hit a lemon tree near Palsakheda Thobre at around 3 am and fled the scene.  Mumtaz requests that the driver be found and legal action be taken against him.

Due to the trauma, Rameshkumar could only file the report on 05/03/2024, after returning from his village.  He alleges that the tractor driver, Balu Gorakh Tandale, was driving recklessly and negligently, causing the accident and the death of his son.

On 03/02/2024, Ganesh left home on his motorcycle for work around 9:00 AM.  Later, around 7:00 PM, Nivrutti Shelar informed Bhimrao that Ganesh had been admitted to Ojas Hospital after being found injured.  Sakubai, Bhimrao's wife, went to the hospital and learned Ganesh had sustained a head injury from a motorcycle accident. Bhimrao joined her the next morning, but Ganesh had passed away.  Nivrutti Shelar led police to the accident site, identified as the road alongside a tin shed and tree near Aai's field. Ganesh's body was sent for post-mortem, and he was cremated. Bhimrao believes Ganesh's death was caused by an unknown vehicle. He requests action against the unknown driver.

After having tea, Khandagale left for Raipur on his motorcycle (MH-28-U-2547) around 6 PM. Around 7 PM, Satbhaye heard about an accident involving a motorcycle and a cruiser on the Tembhurni-Jafrabad Road. He later identified the deceased motorcyclist as Khandagale through a photo circulated on WhatsApp and confirmed it at the hospital.  Khandagale had sustained a fractured leg and severe head injuries. The police had impounded both the motorcycle and the cruiser (MH-24-AF-6082). Satbhaye alleges that the cruiser driver's reckless driving caused the accident and Khandagale's death.

At the Tembhurni Government Hospital, they found Ankush dead from head injuries and burns. Sharad Ugle, who was with Ankush, was unconscious due to head injuries. The other involved motorcycle (MH-28-BC-8542) was driven by Charansing Ramsing Lakhaval from Anchali, Sindkhed Raja, Buldhana, who also died in the accident. Santosh Asaram Brahmanavat, who was with Lakhaval, was injured. The next day, Shelke heard that Lakhaval had been carrying a long iron rod from a well, which caused the accident. Shelke alleges that Lakhaval's negligent and reckless driving led to Ankush's death and the injuries to Sharad Ugle and Santosh Brahmanavat.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Anil Asaram Gote filed a complaint regarding the death of his younger brother, Rahul. Rahul worked on a tractor for the village Sarpanch, Appasaheb Khandare, spreading murum on the road. On May 13, 2024, at around 6:00 AM, Rahul fell from the moving tractor and was run over by the trolley's wheel, sustaining fatal head injuries. He was taken to the government hospital in Satana by the Sarpanch and others but was declared dead.  The tractor was driven by Maroti Gyanaji Mind who is accused of driving negligently and at high speed. The complainant alleges that Mind's actions directly caused his brother's death.

Ganesh was guiding Madhukar Tulshiram Rathod, the tractor driver, at Bramhanwadi Shivar, Partur, Jalna, when the tractor ran over him.  Bhagwat received the news from his nephew, Vinayak, and rushed to Pathri Government Hospital with his other son, Ramesh, where Ganesh was declared dead. narrativeSummary.summary_en: Vishwanath Atmaram Shinde, a 60-year-old farmer, reports that his son, Angad, 34, working at Samriddhi Sugar Limited, left home for work in Ashti on his motorcycle (MH21BZ1589) at 9:00 am on 12/10/2024.  At 7:15 pm, Vishwanath received a call from a relative, Keshav Ugle, informing him of Angad's accident involving a four-wheeler near Dhokmal Pati.  Upon reaching the scene with fellow villagers, they found Angad and his motorcycle on the road, near a red four-wheeler (MH04DN2856). Witnesses claimed the four-wheeler had hit Angad's motorcycle head-on. Angad was taken to Ashti Primary Health Center and then referred to Jalna District General Hospital where he was declared dead. The next day, police conducted a panchnama and a post-mortem was performed.  Vishwanath alleges the driver of the red four-wheeler caused the accident by reckless overtaking, leading to Angad's death and damage to his motorcycle.

They were on their way to visit a friend, Mehebub Shaikh, who was hospitalized in Chhatrapati Sambhaji Nagar.  Raju Baba Beg called the complainant, informing him of an accident near Ashram School on Partur-Ashti Road, where a monkey had caused the motorcycle to crash.  The complainant reached the accident site with his driver and sister-in-law, finding his brother with injuries to his head, shoulder, and stomach and Raju Baba Beg with minor injuries.  Datta Babasaheb Korde was hospitalized in Jalna but succumbed to his injuries on 31/07/2024. The complainant alleges that Raju Baba Beg's rash and negligent driving caused the accident and his brother's death.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Anand Vishwanath Thoke, residing in Nashik, filed a complaint regarding a hit and run incident involving his brother, Manoj Vishwanath Thoke. On March 4, 2024, at approximately 6:30 PM, Manoj was walking home from the weekly market in Satona Khurd when an unidentified motorcyclist recklessly hit him from behind near Satona Bu. Manoj sustained severe head injuries and was taken to Cityscan Hospital in Shelu, then later transferred to Medicouver Hospital in Aurangabad, and finally to Seven Hills Hospital in Mumbai. Despite medical treatment, Manoj succumbed to his injuries on March 9, 2024.  The motorcyclist, accompanied by a woman and a child, also fell from the motorcycle and sustained injuries. They left the scene without reporting the incident.  The complainant requests legal action against the unknown motorcyclist.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Narayan Prabhusing Charawande, a police officer stationed at Hasnabad Police Station, filed a complaint regarding a roadblock organized by Manoj Jarange Patil and the Sakal Maratha Samaj.  Charawande and his team were deployed at Chandai Chowk in Rajur. Despite being informed about a notice served under Section 149 CrPC on 23/02/2024 regarding the roadblock, Kailas Pungle, Karbhari Teple, Vinod Pungle, Raj Thombre, Balu Shinde, and 5-10 other members of the Sakal Maratha Samaj proceeded with the roadblock, obstructing public movement between 11:00 and 11:30 on 24/02/2024.  They were also in violation of prohibitory orders issued by the District Magistrate of Jalna.  The complaint was filed under sections 341, 143 of the IPC and 135 of the Maharashtra Police Act.

Near Paregaon Road, Abhijit's negligent and high-speed driving caused an accident resulting in Kalpana sustaining severe head injuries. She was admitted to Jalna's Sushruta Hospital, referred to JJ Plus Hospital in Sambhajinagar, and then to the Government Hospital's Accident ward. She died during treatment on 21/12/2023 at 13:35.  Vinod, who was undergoing treatment at a mental health center in Padegaon at the time of the incident, learned about the accident from a relative. He alleges that Abhijit is responsible for Kalpana's death due to reckless driving.

Vishnu sustained severe head and hand injuries, while Baliram also suffered injuries.  They were taken to a local doctor in Ramnagar who advised them to go to Jalna.  They were then admitted to Kalavati Hospital in Jalna. Later, Vishnu was shifted to Sambhaji Nagar for further treatment where he succumbed to his injuries on January 31, 2024.  The complainant alleges that the unknown vehicle driver was driving recklessly and negligently, causing the accident and his son's death.

Her son, Akash Jadhav, and his colleague, Ganesh Sonawane, were traveling on a motorcycle (MH-21-BK-2976) from Ambad to Ghansawangi. Avinash alleges that the unknown vehicle driver, driving rashly and negligently, hit his father, causing fatal injuries. The driver fled the scene without providing any assistance or reporting the accident. He requests appropriate legal action against the accused.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: On 13/11/2024, Ranjana Sandipan Baglane, a Police Sub-Inspector stationed at Ambad Police Station, filed a complaint regarding a road accident. On 30/08/2024 at 00:37 hours, Dr. V.M. Kendre informed her about an unidentified person, injured in an accident near Jagdamba Hotel, Lalwadi, Ambad, being brought to Ambad Sub-District Hospital in a private ambulance (MH.04.CP.4558). An Accidental Death Report (ADR) was registered, and an investigation revealed injuries consistent with a road accident. The deceased, approximately 40 years old, was wearing a green, full-sleeved shirt and black night pants. A post-mortem was conducted. Despite attempts to identify the deceased, including circulating a search report, the identity remained unknown. Based on the circumstances, it appears an unknown vehicle driver, driving recklessly and negligently, hit the deceased on 29/08/2024 at 11:30 PM on Jalna-Beed Highway Road, causing fatal injuries. The driver fled the scene without reporting the accident. The complainant requests legal action against the unknown driver under sections 106(1), 281, 125(a), 125(b) of IPC, and 134/177 of MVA.

Around 16:30, near Gundevadi on Samruddhi Highway, Joshi, who was driving their Tata Tiago (MH37V8479), lost control due to speeding and negligent driving, causing the car to hit the dividers and overturn. Harne sustained fatal injuries and was declared dead at Jalna Hospital. Walker and Joshi were also injured and hospitalized. Walker alleges that Joshi's negligent driving caused the accident and Harne's death.

He was taken to the government hospital in Jalna, where he was declared dead.  Due to their difficult financial and emotional state, Dhanwantidevi filed the complaint later. He rushed to the scene with his cousins, Akshay and Shubham Bansile, and found his mother lying near the front wheel of a Tata truck with registration number MH-20 EL.6161. Her head was severely injured. They took her to Jalna General Hospital, where she was declared dead. According to the complainant, his mother was walking home from work when the truck driver, driving recklessly and negligently, hit her from behind and fled the scene without informing anyone.  The front wheel of the truck ran over her head, causing her death.  He requests legal action against the truck driver.

Sachin rushed to the scene and found his father with injuries to his leg and chest.  He and other relatives took Pandit to Jalna General Hospital and then to Om Hospital for further treatment. The FIR alleges that a speeding Honda Unicorn motorcycle (MH21 BW 6389) coming from Jalna collided with Pandit's Hero Honda Deluxe motorcycle (MH20 AX 6738), causing fatal injuries.

Sadashiv Shinde succumbed to his injuries, while Shantabai Shinde was seriously injured and referred to Apex Hospital. Ramdas was informed about the incident via phone call while he was in Mumbai.

He succumbed to his injuries on 14/08/2024.  The complainant requests legal action against the motorcycle rider responsible for the accident.

After completing the registration around 14:50, they were returning towards Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar.  Near Kendhali Pati, opposite Hotel Goraksha, a car (MH-22-AP-4842) driven by an unknown person, driving rashly and negligently, collided with their car.  The accident resulted in severe injuries to all occupants. They were taken to a private hospital in Jalna. Suresh Khanduji Jadhav was referred to the Government Medical College and Hospital, Aurangabad, for further treatment but was declared dead on arrival. Shashikala Waman Khandare also passed away during treatment at Vighnaharta Hospital in Jalna. Ramesh Punjaram More and Puja Vitthal Gawali are currently undergoing treatment at a private hospital.  The complainant alleges that the driver of the other car was responsible for the accident and the deaths of his father and Shashikala Khandare.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Ayaz Rahim Qureshi, a 22-year-old businessman residing in Sartaj Colony, Mantha, lodged a complaint stating that his cousin sister's son, Farhan Iqbal Qureshi, from Jintur, was visiting him. On 18/03/2023, after dinner, around 11:30 PM, Ayaz, Farhan, and their friend Mujahid went to Devthana. While returning to Mantha between 12:30 AM and 1:00 AM, they stopped for tea near Devthana.  While they were at the tea stall, Farhan went to urinate.  As they were paying the bill, a speeding red Eicher truck (MH-48 CB-1179) coming from Mantha towards Jalna hit a parked brick-colored Eicher truck (MH-20 EG-9555).  The speeding truck lost control, veered towards the pedestrian path, and hit Farhan who was standing near the roadside. The truck then overturned, trapping Farhan underneath.  Farhan died on the spot.  People from the hotel and passersby rushed to the scene. Ayaz called his family.  The injured were taken to the government hospital in Mantha in a private ambulance. Farhan's body was extricated from under the truck using a crane.  His body was sent to the Mantha government hospital for postmortem. The next day, after the postmortem, the body was handed over to the relatives for last rites. Due to the grief and the religious rituals, the complaint was filed the following day. Ayaz requests legal action against the driver of the truck MH-48 CB-1179 for causing Farhan's death by driving recklessly and negligently.

Her husband worked as a driver on a Tata truck owned by her brother, Nawab Khan Bashir Khan Pathan. On December 18, 2024, around 1:45 PM, she received a call from Sanjay Chhalani, a ginning mill owner, informing her that her husband had fallen from the truck and was injured.  Upon reaching the Mantha Government Hospital, he was declared dead. Sanjay Chhalani explained that the deceased was tying ropes on a cotton bale loaded on the truck (MH21X2666) at Mahavir Ginning, Talnifata, Mantha.  The accused, Aref Mohammad Shaikh, sat in the driver's seat and moved the truck forward without checking, causing the deceased to fall and suffer fatal head injuries.  The complainant alleges that Aref Mohammad Shaikh's negligence led to her husband's death.

The complainant alleges that the Hyva truck driver recklessly and negligently hit his son's motorcycle, causing fatal injuries.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Uddhav Waghmare reports the death of his father, Sudamrao Waghmare, due to a motorcycle accident.  Sudamrao was riding his Yamaha Crux motorcycle from Kumbhar Pimpgaon towards Fulwadi on 25/04/2024 at around 7:30 PM.  He lost control of the motorcycle when it slipped on a pile of sand left on the road by Ramrao Kantule for construction purposes.  Sudamrao suffered severe head injuries and was taken to various hospitals, eventually succumbing to his injuries on 02/05/2024 at Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar's Government Hospital. Uddhav holds Ramrao Kantule responsible for his father's death due to the negligently placed sand.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Sakharam Kaduba Misal, a 50-year-old farmer from Godri, Chikhali, Buldhana, reports an accident involving an auto-rickshaw (MH28 R 35) driven by Gopal Narayan Molwande.  Misal's sister-in-law, Kantabai Vishwanath Misal (approximately 62 years old), and other women from the village were returning from Tambhewadi after picking cotton when the auto-rickshaw lost control and crashed near a petrol pump on the Tembhurni road in Jaffrabad. Kantabai sustained fatal injuries and passed away at the hospital. Other women in the auto-rickshaw were also injured. The accident occurred around 6:30 pm on 14/11/2024.  Misal alleges that Molwande was driving recklessly and negligently, leading to the accident and his sister-in-law's death.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Pradip Dagdu Kakde, a 30-year-old laborer from Kond, Jaffrabad, Jalna, reported that on 23/04/2024 at 7:45 PM, his nephew Aditya Vinod Kakde (16) and Sumit Vijay Khare (16) were going to Warud Bu on a motorcycle (MH21BS4197) to buy groceries.  Near Ashok Kakde's field, they collided with a stationary borewell truck (KA01MJ6535). The truck was parked halfway on the road with no indicators or warning signs.  Gajanan Lalsing Parihar informed the complainant about the accident. The complainant, along with Ravindra Jagdev Borde, rushed to the scene and found the victims severely injured.  With the help of villagers, they took the victims to Jaffrabad Rural Hospital where they were declared dead. The complainant alleges that the truck driver's negligence caused the accident.

Near Sai Nivasant Hotel in Kolegaon, a speeding motorcycle (MH28.BL3817) driven by Samadhan Purushottam Pawar collided with them.  A witness, Sandip Shelke, informed Keshav's uncle, Shivaji. Upon reaching the scene, Keshav found his mother and brother injured. Sumanbai was declared dead at Gramin Chikhali Hospital, while Purushottam sustained leg injuries and was transferred to Medicover Hospital, Sambhaji Nagar after initial treatment at Janjal Hospital.  Keshav alleges that Samadhan's negligent driving caused the accident and his mother's death.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Balasaheb Devidas Lokhande, residing in Chinchkheda, Jaffrabad, Jalna, has filed a complaint regarding a fatal accident involving his brother, Arun Devidas Lokhande. Arun, who worked in Bhokardan, commuted daily on his motorcycle (MH20BD9927). On August 9, 2024, around 8 PM, Balasaheb received a call from Ramesh Rajaram Mule informing him about an accident involving Arun.  Shankar Narayan Jadhav, driving motorcycle MH21AJ7982, had collided head-on with Arun's motorcycle on the Kolhapur-Asai Fata road.  Arun was severely injured and taken to Bhokardan Government Hospital.  He was later transferred to JJ Plus Hospital in Sambhajinagar for further treatment, where he succumbed to his injuries on August 10, 2024, at 11:30 AM. Balasaheb alleges that Shankar Narayan Jadhav drove recklessly and negligently, causing the accident and his brother's death.

While crossing the road, he was fatally hit by an unknown four-wheeler speeding towards Mahora from Dhad. Shelke was taken to Dhad Government Hospital but declared dead. Uike requests action against the unknown driver for reckless and negligent driving.

Shenfad was informed of the accident by another cousin, Sanjay Ramrao Wagh. Upon reaching the Jaffrabad Government Hospital, he found Ramesh deceased. Sanjay informed Shenfad that Ramesh was riding Madhukar Dagdu Lokhande's motorcycle at the time of the accident.

On 29/05/2024, around 8:30 PM, Devchand was walking home from Papal on the Jafrabad-Bhokardan road when an unidentified white pickup truck hit him from behind near the MSEB office.  The driver fled the scene without providing any assistance.  Devchand was taken to the hospital in a private vehicle but was declared dead on arrival.  The family performed the last rites the following day after the post-mortem.  Jagat was unable to file the complaint earlier due to grief and emotional distress. He requests that the police investigate the incident, locate the unknown driver and vehicle, and take appropriate legal action.

Sainath suffered fatal injuries, while Jyoti and Shrikant sustained injuries.  Sunil Ambhore and Akash Bidve were among the first to arrive at the scene and took the injured to the hospital. Sainath was declared dead at Jafrabad Government Hospital.

The truck, driven by Sheikh Farukh Sheikh Raees, overturned near Golapangri on Jalna-Ambad Road.  Sayyad Arsiyan was declared dead upon arrival at Jalna Government Hospital. The complainant alleges that Sheikh Farukh drove recklessly and fled the scene after the accident, causing his son's death.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Shanti Balbirsingh Rana, residing at SRPF Group Jalna, filed a complaint regarding an accident involving her husband, Balbirsingh Gangasingh Rana. On January 31, 2024, around 8:30-9:00 PM, Balbirsingh was riding his scooter (MH21BN6233) towards DMart after finishing his duty at SRPF Group Jalna.  Near Laxmi Residency, Jalna, an unidentified black and yellow vehicle (MH20BT5124) hit his scooter from behind.  A witness, Manoharsingh Nandansingh Bafila, noted the vehicle's registration number. The vehicle fled the scene. Balbirsingh was taken to Kalawati Hospital, Jalna, and later to Singma Hospital, Aurangabad, where he succumbed to his injuries on February 10, 2024.  The complainant and her family were grieving and did not file a complaint immediately.  This report is being filed now against the driver of the black and yellow vehicle for causing the accident and subsequent death of Balbirsingh.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Sunil Shinde, a 35-year-old water cart operator, reports that on March 25, 2024, at around 3:00 PM, he received a call from his friend Raju Nandal informing him about an accident involving his brother, Pramod Shinde, near the Regaon T-Point railway overbridge.  He and his friend Mayur Dhotre rushed to Kalavati Hospital in Jalna where Pramod had been admitted.  Due to his serious condition, Pramod was referred to J.J. Plus Hospital in Sambhajinagar where he was admitted at 5:00 PM. On March 29, 2024, at 9:30 AM, Pramod was declared dead. An Accidental Death Report (ADR) No. 00/14/24 under section 174 CrPC was registered at Kranti Chowk Police Station, Sambhajinagar. The ADR investigation was handled by Police Constable/328 P.S. Patil. After the post-mortem, the ADR documents were transferred to Taluka Jalna Police Station. The complainant states that Pramod and Ramesh Dalvi were traveling on a HF Deluxe motorcycle (MH-21BT6370) from Mantha Chowk towards Ambad Chowk when an unknown vehicle, driven rashly and negligently, hit their motorcycle near the Regaon T-Point railway overbridge. This caused severe head injuries to Pramod, leading to his death. The driver of the unknown vehicle fled the scene.

Kale learned that Ubale was walking home from Jalna city on 27/7/2024 after visiting a bank when an unknown vehicle hit him. The driver fled the scene without providing any assistance.  Kale alleges that the unknown driver was driving recklessly and negligently, causing the fatal accident.

After seven days, Dinkar was transferred to Ghatti Hospital where he died five days later.  Appasaheb Dhawale admitted to drinking and driving with Dinkar when their motorcycle hit a divider near Wagul Fata, resulting in the accident.

Eknath had left home around 6 PM on 17/05/2024 to sleep at their farm as usual. The next morning at 8 AM, a neighbor, Kisan Gaikwad, informed Raju about the accident.  Raju, his mother, and cousin rushed to the scene and found Eknath deceased on the Navha Highway Road. The unknown vehicle driver had fled the scene. They took Eknath's body to Jalna Government Hospital for post-mortem and performed the last rites. An Accidental Death Report (ADR) No. 44/2024 under section 174 CrPC has been filed at Jalna Taluka Police Station.  Raju requests action against the unknown driver.

Around 5:30 PM, while they were crossing the road to have juice near Darshana Nagar petrol pump on Jalna Jamwadi Road, an unknown motorcyclist (MH.20.GR.9173) driving recklessly and at high speed hit their motorcycle (MH.21.BR.7527).  His parents fell and were seriously injured.  The complainant was informed about the accident by his friend, Shivaji Lad, and rushed to Aastha Hospital. The doctors informed him that his father's condition was critical due to excessive bleeding and head injury. Later, his father passed away at around 6:30 PM. He took his mother to Kalavati Hospital, where she was admitted with head and hand injuries. His father was later declared dead at Jalna General Hospital.  The complainant alleges that the reckless driving of the accused motorcyclist caused the accident and his father's death.

While the travels stopped for tea at a hotel a little ahead of Anandgad, her husband went across the road to urinate.  As he was returning, an unidentified car, driven rashly and negligently, hit him.  He sustained severe injuries and was admitted to the government hospital in Jalna, where he later died on 04/05/2024 at 1:00 am. The car driver fled the scene without reporting the accident.  She requests appropriate legal action against the driver.

They learned Shaikh Kalim died in an accident at Rammurti on 31/10/2024 at around 9:10 pm. An unknown vehicle driver, driving negligently and at high speed, hit Shaikh Kalim, causing fatal injuries. The driver left the scene without informing anyone. Shaikh Faizan filed a complaint against the unknown driver.

Atmaram was riding his motorcycle (MH-21-BJ-8680) to visit his aunt in Daregaon on July 21, 2024, at around 9:00 PM. Ramdas received a call informing him about the accident and rushed to the scene.  Upon arrival, they found the motorcycle but not Atmaram. They found him unconscious at the Ghat Government Hospital.  Due to the severity of his injuries, Atmaram was referred to Sanjivani Hospital in Jalna, and later to Medicover Hospital in Aurangabad.  He suffered a broken leg and other injuries, requiring surgery. Ramdas alleges that an unknown vehicle hit Atmaram's motorcycle, causing the accident. The driver fled the scene without stopping.

Irfan Shaikh was admitted there. Tausif Shaikh was shifted to General Hospital, Jalna, where he was declared dead.  Ebrahim informed the complainant that Irfan Shaikh was driving the motorcycle (MH21CB0596) with Tausif Shaikh as a pillion rider.  A speeding Quid car (MH21AX1623) hit the motorcycle head-on at Kanhaiyanagar T Point. The driver of the car is unknown.  Irfan Shaikh sustained head and waist injuries, and Tausif Shaikh sustained fatal head injuries.

Chitra Manoharan succumbed to her injuries on 30/01/2024.  Shashikumar requests legal action against the unknown driver who fled the scene.

Both Prabhakar and Pawan sustained head injuries and were taken to Vira Hospital in Jalna. Prabhakar was later referred to a hospital in Washim but died en route. Pawan was discharged after treatment. The complainant alleges that the unknown truck driver hit his car and fled the scene.

Ganesh suffered severe injuries and was taken to the hospital by witnesses, but he succumbed to his injuries.  The accused fled the scene without providing any medical assistance.  The complainant requests legal action against the accused.

They were returning to Mumbai via the Samruddhi Highway when their Ertiga car was hit by a Swift Dzire car coming from the wrong side. The accident resulted in the death of three passengers in Shakeel's car, including his two sons and nephew, and injuries to others. The driver of the Swift Dzire car, Sandeep Budhwant, and two unidentified passengers in his car were also deceased. Shakeel filed a complaint against Sandeep Budhwant.

He stated that on July 14, 2024, at around 6:00 PM, his mother, Sindhubai, along with Sarjerao Thakur and Nandabai, went to cater a wedding at Gayatri Lawns. On July 15, 2024, at approximately 1:45 AM, he received a call from his sister, Nita Bhalmode, informing him about his mother's accident near Matoshri Lawns on Ambad Jalna Road. Upon reaching the scene, he found his mother bleeding from a head injury. Sarjerao Thakur was not present at the scene. He took his mother and Nandabai to the hospital in an ambulance, where his mother was declared dead. Nandabai stated she didn't know how the accident occurred. Sunil alleges an unknown vehicle driver hit his mother, causing her death.

On 14/08/2023, around 01:30 AM, while returning from Pune to Rathi Antarwali on his cousin Karan Baliram Gavhane's motorcycle (MH.04.DC.554), they met with an accident near Pokalwad village on Jalna-Ghansawangi Road. Due to loss of control, the motorcycle went off the road. Deepak Sable sustained injuries on his left chest, hand, face, and abdomen, while Karan Gavhane suffered severe head injuries. They were taken to Jalna Government Hospital and later shifted to a hospital in Sambhajinagar for further treatment. Karan Gavhane died during treatment on 19/08/2023 at around 01:30 PM. Deepak Sable alleges that Karan Gavhane was responsible for the accident due to reckless driving.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Police Constable 1929 V.R. Chaudhary filed a report based on the information provided by Duty Officer PI Bansode. The informant, Dr. Sheetal Jagdale from Vaidyanath Super Speciality Hospital, Nanded Bidco, Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, reported an accident (MLC No. 107/2024 dated 17/11/2024 at 7:10 am). Ganesh Kailas Chaudhary, aged 25, a resident of Dhandegaov, Jalna, was driving from Jalna to Dhandegaov on 10/11/2024 at 10:30 pm when his vehicle hit a divider near Rammurti Square. He sustained head injuries and passed away on 17/11/2024 at 6:50 am. Post-mortem (PM No. 2686/2024 dated 17/11/2024) confirmed the cause of death as head injury. The body was handed over to the deceased's uncle, Gopinath Chaudhary, after completing necessary formalities. As the incident occurred within the jurisdiction of Jalna Taluk Police Station, the original documents were transferred there. Ganesh Kailas Chaudhary is deemed responsible for his own death due to negligent and reckless driving at high speed, losing control of the vehicle, and colliding with the divider.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Raju Narayan Ghode, a 45-year-old laborer residing in Kothi, Ghansawangi, Jalna, reports that his 20-year-old son, Ajay Raju Ghode, was working as a farmhand for Chandrashekhar Pandhare for the past three years. On June 7, 2024, at approximately 10:00 PM, Ajay was operating a Mahindra tractor (MH-21-BV-7724) with a rotavator attached. While working on a farm boundary, the tractor overturned, trapping Ajay underneath.  Dinesh Chandrashekhar Pandhare, Dwarka Raju Ghode, and Sharad Datta Borade extracted Ajay and took him to the Ghansawangi Government Hospital, where he was declared dead. Due to the late hour, the police conducted the inquest the following day. After the post-mortem examination, Ajay's body was released to his family for last rites, which were performed according to their customs in Kothi.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Shridhar Suryabhan Khadekar, ASI/499 at Tirthpuri Police Station, filed a complaint regarding a motor vehicle accident. Amol Gulabrao Raut allowed his underage son, Mahesh Amol Raut (16 years old, without a driving license), to ride his Mahindra motorcycle (MH-21-AK-5849).  On 17/04/2024, around 8:30 PM, Mahesh was riding the motorcycle towards their farm in Mudhregaon Shivar when it slipped, causing injuries. He was admitted to Kalavati Hospital, Jalna, and discharged after treatment.  However, he experienced stomach pain the next day and was admitted to MGM Hospital, Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, where he died on 25/04/2024 at 5:30 PM. The complainant alleges that Amol Gulabrao Raut is responsible for his son's death as he allowed him to ride the motorcycle despite being underage and unlicensed. The FIR is filed under IPC 304-A and Motor Vehicles Act 5/180.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Gajanan Ramesh Sable, a 26-year-old farmer from Lingwadi, Bhokardan, Jalna, lodged a complaint stating that on December 22, 2024, at around 4:30 PM, while he and his relative, Vishal Sanjay Sable, were traveling on a motorcycle from Lingwadi to Bhokardan, a truck (GJ-10 TV 5423) driving recklessly from Jalna to Bhokardan hit their motorcycle from behind near Kaka Petrol Pump. Gajanan Sable fell on the right side of the road and sustained minor injuries. Vishal Sanjay Sable, who was riding pillion, fell in the middle of the road and was run over by the truck's tires. He sustained severe injuries to his head, chest, abdomen, and legs, and his intestines protruded out due to the impact. He was rushed to the hospital but was declared dead at around 5:00 PM. The next day, a post-mortem was conducted, and the body was handed over to the family for last rites. Gajanan Sable alleges that the truck driver's negligence caused the accident and Vishal Sanjay Sable's death.

narrativeSummary.summary_en: Raju Baburao Sable, a 24-year-old JCB operator, reports an accident that occurred on July 18, 2024, at around 8:15 PM near Dawargaon Pati, Bhokardan. While returning from a trip to Rajur Ganpati temple with his cousin Sandeep Sable, friend Deepak Lahudkar, and Rameshwar Jagdhane in Deepak's Swift car (MH23 AD 4363), a speeding tanker (MH 04GR 0588) hit their car from behind, causing it to overturn.  Raju, Sandeep, Deepak, and Rameshwar sustained injuries. A hotel owner, Satish Bhagwat, took Raju, Deepak, and Rameshwar to Bhokardan Government Hospital. Later, Ajinath Kolhe brought Sandeep to the same hospital, where he was declared dead. Raju, with severe injuries to his head, left shoulder, and neck, was referred to Jalna District Hospital and subsequently to Sambhajinagar Ghat Hospital, where he was discharged on July 19, 2024, at 4 AM.  Raju requests legal action against the tanker driver for reckless driving.
